newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Britain wants to sell submarines to Portugal-paper.
newsitem.headline: Britain wants to sell submarines to Portugal-paper.

text.p: Britain is interested in selling used, non-nuclear submarines to Portugal, Britain's chief military officer, Sir Peter Inge, was quoted as saying on Monday.

"They are traditional, diesel, non-nuclear submarines. I know that there are contacts and initiatives for their sale taking place," Inge told Diario de Noticias newspaper in an interview during a visit to Lisbon.

"The decision (to buy) is a matter for the Portuguese government. For our part, we are ready to make a contribution and to discuss the matter, notably with regard to the financial and training programme," he added.
Asked if the financial offer would appeal to the Portuguese government, Inge said: "I am sure that it is attractive."
He gave no further details and officials were not immediately available to confirm the report.
Diario de Noticias said that Portugal was considering updating its non-nuclear submarines.
